title: Block on rotating disk friction experiment

content.question: During an experiment, a block of mass <math alttext="M equals 0.20 kilogram" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>M</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0.20</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>kg</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is placed on a disk that rotates about an axle through its center, as shown in the diagram. The block is moved to different distances <math alttext="uppercase R" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> from the axle, and the tangential speed of the block is gradually increased until the mass begins to slip. The distance and maximum tangential speed before slipping, <math alttext="v sub max" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>max</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></math>, are recorded. A student creates a graph of <math alttext="v sub max squared" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>max</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> as a function of <math alttext="uppercase R" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, as shown. How should the student use the graph to most accurately determine the experimental value of the coefficient of static friction <math alttext="mu sub s" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>μ</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>S</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> between the block and the disk?

choices.label: Determine the slope of the best fit line, and it will be equal to <math alttext="mu sub s" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>μ</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>S</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>.

Determine the slope of the best fit line and set it equal to <math alttext="mu sub s, g" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>μ</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>S</mi></mrow></msub><mtext>g</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

Determine the maximum value on the curve and use the data from that point in the equation <math alttext="v squared equals, mu sub s, g, uppercase R" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>μ</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>S</mi></mrow></msub><mtext>g</mtext><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>.

Determine the midpoint value on the curve and use the data from that point in the equation <math alttext="v squared equals, mu sub s, g, uppercase R" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>μ</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>S</mi></mrow></msub><mtext>g</mtext><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: Determine the slope of the best fit line and set it equal to <math alttext="mu sub s, g" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>μ</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>S</mi></mrow></msub><mtext>g</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.
